title: Kalchef
author: Kalchef
content: Can anyone tell me the reason why SEC is investigating Binance BNB? Like there must be something going on before the investigation or SEC can just choose any project to investigate? Please tell me more about how SEC works.

comments.author: JeffBrad12
comments.body: Quote from: Kalchef on June 07, 2022, 07:48:33 AMCan anyone tell me the reason why SEC is investigating Binance BNB?I can't tell you the reason but have you read all of explanation in the article. It was investigating binance exchange site caused by it was conducting ICO a few years ago. Im sure that SEC was always doing this kind of shit. Just ignore it. SEC was only looking for some money from binance. Binance can pay fine easily. Quote from: Kalchef on June 07, 2022, 07:48:33 AM Like there must be something going on before the investigation or SEC can just choose any project to investigate? Please tell me more about how SEC works.No man, it's just a typical of SEC that was coming after years. SEC was also doing the same with another project in the crypto. They did know so well when the crypto project was conducting ico but SEC was attacking crypto right now

comments.body: Quote from: Kalchef on June 07, 2022, 07:48:33 AMCan anyone tell me the reason why SEC is investigating Binance BNB? Like there must be something going on before the investigation or SEC can just choose any project to investigate? Please tell me more about how SEC works.They've been doing this to almost every successful project so, this isn't surprising that BNB has taken into their attention but it's long overdue. It's just about being registered as a security or not. BNB can easily defend itself on this investigation, they've got all the resources and money to defend whatever they want to defend if the SEC asks so.

comments.body: You can check out a topic created by bbc.reporter entitled Binance to be investigated by SEC on ICO of BNB[1].There is a reference link there and it's pointed at Coin Telegraph[2].SEC on the other hand focuses on protecting investors by regulating markets. You can check and read it more in-depth here[3]References:[1] - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5401624[2] - https://cointelegraph.com/news/bad-day-for-binance-with-sec-investigation-and-reuters-expose[3] - https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sec.asp

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: There is really nothing going on with it, it is just a regular thing and we shouldn't be shocked about it. I personally believe that SEC just saw that there is a good chance they could end up making some money from it, investigate it further, find any loopholes or problems there, and end up using that to extort money out of Binance saying they did something wrong.Binance will want to continue to work with USA, so they will pay it, to keep it silent and not create any issues and that way everyone wins. Remember the old USDT one? That was a hoax as well, USDT had a ton of problems but paid a small fee and got out without any damages to them at all.
